name: asherdan
text: A comment left by asherdan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Moraiat, robbingdog, patiently56, Mbain3001, regrepsnefpoh, cashprizes, Afkpuz, werthog42, Badgerus, usversusthem, yingkaixing, dropkickpikachu)

name: farqussus
text: A comment left by farqussus was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by patkun, straw, jaredwilde, kaseru, lordatog, goocifer, robbingdog, MortisInvictus, SpinyNorman, nutmeg, scraggg, yingkaixing, sexualhomeboy, Tipist)

name: asherdan
text: A comment left by asherdan was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by barfighting, quaga, robbingdog, farqussus, nutmeg, Wulvaine, usversusthem, yingkaixing, saucy_jack, Tipist)

name: nutmeg
text: unnecessary and terrible.

name: i_love_kate
text: Oop, got to side with Asherdan on this one, seeing as he's mirroring a Stephen Fry line. Intentional quote or not, you can't argue with Fry.

name: anticitizen
text:
those who try are always wrong.

dead wrong

name: deimosrising
text: Note the stew metaphor which pervades this arc. What does this symbolize? Compare to your other readings this semester (Moby Dick, The Dream of the Red Chamber): How can this metaphor be applied to them?

name: catachresis
text: A comment left by catachresis was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by tttt, MinorTough, SSDDR, MortisInvictus)

name: ssddr
text: what?

name: catachresis
text: SPLUT

name: zefiel
text: Man that onomatopoeia  doesn't exclusively belong to Garfield

name: dougthehead
text: No... but Garfield is the only comic to dedicate an entire week exclusively to "SPLUT."  Whenever I use that onomatopoeia in my comic, I think of it as a Garfield reference.

name: unfun
text: Here is another use of "splut" in Achewood

name: unfun
text: Sorry... here

name: catachresis
text: The difference in severity between Garfield's "splut" and the "splut" linked above cannot possibly be overstated

name: dougthehead
text:
What? They're pretty similar. One's a pie hitting a fat cat in the face, the other's an internet-ready stabbing machine with a faulty driver hitting a West-Virginia-bred serial killer cat in the face.


...oh...

name: rowboat
text: For a handy guide to the "spluts" of Achewood, see thatcrazycommie's post from 10/17/07 (as well as the strip from that day).

name: kledermans
text: You know, sometimes I picture Roast Beef as speaking in the voice of Lorenzo Music.  His voice just had that slow, sad quality to it.  Unfortunately, it's already famous as the voice of Garfield, so that would make it awkward.

name: _pink
text: Chubbied, two years late.

name: josher
text: Showbiz gets "Michael", Roast Beef gets "Cassandra". A psychological point could probably be made about this.

name: deusoma
text: Showbiz wasn't born a manlady.

name: i_love_kate
text: Have you not seen his downstairs mixup?

name: awko
text: I love that his mail gets addressed to Michael "Showbiz" Kazenzakis.

name: charchar
text: I love how it's addressed to 'general delivery.'  That is some subtle love & squalour.

name: m-e-charm
text:
I didn't laugh, but this comic still grabs me in a way.
Dig Achewood.

name: fosters
text: What gets me here is that beef is actually going to do the goddamned dishes.

name: irondave
text: So true.  It is meaningful in a way I can't describe.  He helps his brother even though his brother doesn't really deserve it.

name: kyrasmash
text: Five for the alt text.

name: wharfrat
text: Roast Beef looks so sad when he holds the cat sized bottle of soap, i almost feel a tear
